metadata.title: CVE-2021-23987 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 86 and Firefox ESR 78.8. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23987` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
